intro: Aspidopterys oligoneura, commonly known as the Hawaiian tree fern, is a species native to the island of Hawaii. It is a member of the Cyatheaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feathery fronds. The plant has a distinctive crown of elongated, pinnately compound leaves that can reach several meters in length. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforest habitats. Aspidopterys oligoneura plays an important ecological role in its native ecosystem, providing habitat and food for various native species.
